 146 -    def download_kml(self, url, public_url): 

 147          """ 
 148          Download a KML file: 
 149              - unzip it if-required 
 150              - follow NetworkLinks recursively if-required 
 151   
 152          Returns a file object 
 153          """ 
 154   
 155          response = self.response 
 156          session = self.session 
 157   
 158          file = "" 
 159          warning = "" 
 160   
 161          if len(url) > len(public_url) and url[:len(public_url)] == public_url: 
 162              # Keep Session for local URLs 
 163              cookie = Cookie.SimpleCookie() 
 164              cookie[response.session_id_name] = response.session_id 
 165              session._unlock(response) 
 166              try: 
 167                  file = fetch(url, cookie=cookie) 
 168              except urllib2.URLError: 
 169                  warning = "URLError" 
 170                  return file, warning 
 171              except urllib2.HTTPError: 
 172                  warning = "HTTPError" 
 173                  return file, warning 
 174   
 175          else: 
 176              try: 
 177                  file = fetch(url) 
 178              except urllib2.URLError: 
 179                  warning = "URLError" 
 180                  return file, warning 
 181              except urllib2.HTTPError: 
 182                  warning = "HTTPError" 
 183                  return file, warning 
 184   
 185              if file[:2] == "PK": 
 186                  # Unzip 
 187                  fp = StringIO(file) 
 188                  myfile = zipfile.ZipFile(fp) 
 189                  try: 
 190                      file = myfile.read("doc.kml") 
 191                  except: 
 192                      file = myfile.read(myfile.infolist()[0].filename) 
 193                  myfile.close() 
 194   
 195              # Check for NetworkLink 
 196              if "<NetworkLink>" in file: 
 197                  # Remove extraneous whitespace 
 198                  #file = " ".join(file.split()) 
 199                  try: 
 200                      parser = etree.XMLParser(recover=True, remove_blank_text=True) 
 201                      tree = etree.XML(file, parser) 
 202                      # Find contents of href tag (must be a better way?) 
 203                      url = "" 
 204                      for element in tree.iter(): 
 205                          if element.tag == "{%s}href" % KML_NAMESPACE: 
 206                              url = element.text 
 207                      if url: 
 208                          file, warning2 = self.download_kml(url, public_url) 
 209                          warning += warning2 
 210                  except (etree.XMLSyntaxError,): 
 211                      e = sys.exc_info()[1] 
 212                      warning += "<ParseError>%s %s</ParseError>" % (e.line, e.errormsg) 
 213   
 214              # Check for Overlays 
 215              if "<GroundOverlay>" in file: 
 216                  warning += "GroundOverlay" 
 217              if "<ScreenOverlay>" in file: 
 218                  warning += "ScreenOverlay" 
 219   
 220          return file, warning

 235 -    def get_bearing(self, lat_start, lon_start, lat_end, lon_end): 

 236          """ 
 237              Given a Start & End set of Coordinates, return a Bearing 
 238              Formula from: http://www.movable-type.co.uk/scripts/latlong.html 
 239          """ 
 240   
 241          import math 
 242   
 243          delta_lon = lon_start - lon_end 
 244          bearing = math.atan2( math.sin(delta_lon)*math.cos(lat_end) , (math.cos(lat_start)*math.sin(lat_end)) - (math.sin(lat_start)*math.cos(lat_end)*math.cos(delta_lon)) ) 
 245          # Convert to a compass bearing 
 246          bearing = (bearing + 360) % 360 
 247   
 248          return bearing

 291 -    def get_children(self, parent_id): 

 292          """ 
 293          Return a list of all GIS Features which are children of 
 294          the requested feature, using Materialized path for retrieving 
 295          the children 
 296   
 297          @author: Aravind Venkatesan and Ajay Kumar Sreenivasan from NCSU 
 298   
 299          This has been chosen over Modified Preorder Tree Traversal for greater efficiency: 
 300          http://eden.sahanafoundation.org/wiki/HaitiGISToDo#HierarchicalTrees 
 301          """ 
 302   
 303          db = self.db 
 304          list = [] 
 305          table = db.gis_location 
 306          parent_path = db(table.id == parent_id).select(table.path) 
 307          if(parent_path[0].path == None): 
 308              path = str(parent_id) 
 309          else: 
 310              path = parent_path[0].path 
 311          for row in db(table.path.like(path + "/%")).select(): 
 312              list.append(row.id) 
 313   
 314          return list

 464 -    def get_features_in_radius(self, lat, lon, radius, tablename=None, category=None):

 545          else: 
 546              # Calculate in Python 
 547              # Pull back all the rows within a square bounding box (faster than checking all features manually) 
 548              # Then check each feature within this subset 
 549              # http://janmatuschek.de/LatitudeLongitudeBoundingCoordinates 
 550   
 551              # @ToDo: Support optional Category (make this a generic filter?) 
 552   
 553              # shortcuts 
 554              radians = math.radians 
 555              degrees = math.degrees 
 556   
 557              MIN_LAT = radians(-90)     # -PI/2 
 558              MAX_LAT = radians(90)      # PI/2 
 559              MIN_LON = radians(-180)    # -PI 
 560              MAX_LON = radians(180)     #  PI 
 561   
 562              # Convert to radians for the calculation 
 563              r = float(radius) / RADIUS_EARTH 
 564              radLat = radians(lat) 
 565              radLon = radians(lon) 
 566   
 567              # Calculate the bounding box 
 568              minLat = radLat - r 
 569              maxLat = radLat + r 
 570   
 571              if (minLat > MIN_LAT) and (maxLat < MAX_LAT): 
 572                  deltaLon = math.asin(math.sin(r) / math.cos(radLat)) 
 573                  minLon = radLon - deltaLon 
 574                  if (minLon < MIN_LON): 
 575                      minLon += 2 * math.pi 
 576                  maxLon = radLon + deltaLon 
 577                  if (maxLon > MAX_LON): 
 578                      maxLon -= 2 * math.pi 
 579              else: 
 580                  # Special care for Poles & 180 Meridian: 
 581                  # http://janmatuschek.de/LatitudeLongitudeBoundingCoordinates#PolesAnd180thMeridian 
 582                  minLat = max(minLat, MIN_LAT) 
 583                  maxLat = min(maxLat, MAX_LAT) 
 584                  minLon = MIN_LON 
 585                  maxLon = MAX_LON 
 586   
 587              # Convert back to degrees 
 588              minLat = degrees(minLat) 
 589              minLon = degrees(minLon) 
 590              maxLat = degrees(maxLat) 
 591              maxLon = degrees(maxLon) 
 592   
 593              # shortcut 
 594              locations = db.gis_location 
 595   
 596              query = (locations.lat > minLat) & (locations.lat < maxLat) & (locations.lon > minLon) & (locations.lon < maxLon) 
 597              deleted = (locations.deleted == False) 
 598              empty = (locations.lat != None) & (locations.lon != None) 
 599              query = deleted & empty & query 
 600   
 601              if tablename: 
 602                  # Lookup the resource 
 603                  table = db[tablename] 
 604                  query = query & (table.location_id == locations.id) 
 605                  records = db(query).select(table.ALL, 
 606                                             locations.id, 
 607                                             locations.name, 
 608                                             locations.level, 
 609                                             locations.lat, 
 610                                             locations.lon, 
 611                                             locations.lat_min, 
 612                                             locations.lon_min, 
 613                                             locations.lat_max, 
 614                                             locations.lon_max) 
 615              else: 
 616                  # Lookup the raw Locations 
 617                  records = db(query).select(locations.id, 
 618                                             locations.name, 
 619                                             locations.level, 
 620                                             locations.lat, 
 621                                             locations.lon, 
 622                                             locations.lat_min, 
 623                                             locations.lon_min, 
 624                                             locations.lat_max, 
 625                                             locations.lon_max) 
 626              features = [] 
 627              for record in records: 
 628                  # Calculate the Great Circle distance 
 629                  if tablename: 
 630                      distance = self.greatCircleDistance(lat, 
 631                                                          lon, 
 632                                                          record.gis_location.lat, 
 633                                                          record.gis_location.lon) 
 634                  else: 
 635                      distance = self.greatCircleDistance(lat, 
 636                                                          lon, 
 637                                                          record.lat, 
 638                                                          record.lon) 
 639                  if distance < radius: 
 640                      features.append(record) 
 641                  else: 
 642                      # skip 
 643                      continue 
 644   
 645              return features

 800 -    def greatCircleDistance(self, lat1, lon1, lat2, lon2, quick=True): 

 801   
 802          """ 
 803              Calculate the shortest distance (in km) over the earth's sphere between 2 points 
 804              Formulae from: http://www.movable-type.co.uk/scripts/latlong.html 
 805              (NB We should normally use PostGIS functions, where possible, instead of this query) 
 806          """ 
 807   
 808          # shortcuts 
 809          cos = math.cos 
 810          sin = math.sin 
 811          radians = math.radians 
 812   
 813          if quick: 
 814              # Spherical Law of Cosines (accurate down to around 1m & computationally quick) 
 815              acos = math.acos 
 816              lat1 = radians(lat1) 
 817              lat2 = radians(lat2) 
 818              lon1 = radians(lon1) 
 819              lon2 = radians(lon2) 
 820              distance = acos(sin(lat1) * sin(lat2) + cos(lat1) * cos(lat2) * cos(lon2-lon1)) * RADIUS_EARTH 
 821              return distance 
 822   
 823          else: 
 824              # Haversine 
 825              #asin = math.asin 
 826              atan2 = math.atan2 
 827              sqrt = math.sqrt 
 828              pow = math.pow 
 829              dLat = radians(lat2-lat1) 
 830              dLon = radians(lon2-lon1) 
 831              a = pow(sin(dLat / 2), 2) + cos(radians(lat1)) * cos(radians(lat2)) * pow(sin(dLon / 2), 2) 
 832              c = 2 * atan2(sqrt(a), sqrt(1-a)) 
 833              #c = 2 * asin(sqrt(a))              # Alternate version 
 834              # Convert radians to kilometers 
 835              distance = RADIUS_EARTH * c 
 836              return distance

1221 -    def parse_location(self, wkt, lon=None, lat=None): 

1222          """ 
1223              Parses a location from wkt, returning wkt, lat, lon, bounding box and type. 
1224              For points, wkt may be None if lat and lon are provided; wkt will be generated. 
1225              For lines and polygons, the lat, lon returned represent the shape's centroid. 
1226              Centroid and bounding box will be None if Shapely is not available. 
1227          """ 
1228   
1229          if not wkt: 
1230              assert lon is not None and lat is not None, "Need wkt or lon+lat to parse a location" 
1231              wkt = "POINT(%f %f)" % (lon, lat) 
1232              geom_type = GEOM_TYPES["point"] 
1233              bbox = (lon, lat, lon, lat) 
1234          else: 
1235              if SHAPELY: 
1236                  shape = shapely.wkt.loads(wkt) 
1237                  centroid = shape.centroid 
1238                  lat = centroid.y 
1239                  lon = centroid.x 
1240                  geom_type = GEOM_TYPES[shape.type.lower()] 
1241                  bbox = shape.bounds 
1242              else: 
1243                  lat = None 
1244                  lon = None 
1245                  geom_type = GEOM_TYPES[wkt.split("(")[0].lower()] 
1246                  bbox = None 
1247   
1248          res = {"wkt": wkt, "lat": lat, "lon": lon, "gis_feature_type": geom_type} 
1249          if bbox: 
1250              res["lon_min"], res["lat_min"], res["lon_max"], res["lat_max"] = bbox 
1251   
1252          return res

1259              @summary: Using Materialized path for each node in the tree 
1260              http://eden.sahanafoundation.org/wiki/HaitiGISToDo#HierarchicalTrees

1280 -    def wkt_centroid(self, form): 

1281          """ 
1282              OnValidation callback: 
1283              If a Point has LonLat defined: calculate the WKT. 
1284              If a Line/Polygon has WKT defined: validate the format, 
1285                  calculate the LonLat of the Centroid, and set bounds 
1286              Centroid and bounds calculation is done using Shapely, which wraps Geos. 
1287              A nice description of the algorithm is provided here: http://www.jennessent.com/arcgis/shapes_poster.htm 
1288   
1289              Relies on Shapely. 
1290              @ToDo provide an option to use PostGIS/Spatialite 
1291          """ 
1292   
1293          if not "gis_feature_type" in form.vars: 
1294              # Default to point 
1295              form.vars.gis_feature_type = "1" 
1296   
1297          if form.vars.gis_feature_type == "1": 
1298              # Point 
1299              if form.vars.lon == None and form.vars.lat == None: 
1300                  # No geo to create WKT from, so skip 
1301                  return 
1302              elif form.vars.lat == None: 
1303                  form.errors["lat"] = self.messages.lat_empty 
1304                  return 
1305              elif form.vars.lon == None: 
1306                  form.errors["lon"] = self.messages.lon_empty 
1307                  return 
1308              else: 
1309                  form.vars.wkt = "POINT(%(lon)f %(lat)f)" % form.vars 
1310                  form.vars.lon_min = form.vars.lon_max = form.vars.lon 
1311                  form.vars.lat_min = form.vars.lat_max = form.vars.lat 
1312                  return 
1313   
1314          elif form.vars.gis_feature_type in ("2", "3"): 
1315              # Parse WKT for LineString, Polygon 
1316              try: 
1317                  try: 
1318                      shape = wkt_loads(form.vars.wkt) 
1319                  except: 
1320                      if form.vars.gis_feature_type  == "2": 
1321                          form.errors["wkt"] = self.messages.invalid_wkt_linestring 
1322                      else: 
1323                          # "3" 
1324                          form.errors["wkt"] = self.messages.invalid_wkt_polygon 
1325                      return 
1326                  centroid_point = shape.centroid 
1327                  form.vars.lon = centroid_point.x 
1328                  form.vars.lat = centroid_point.y 
1329                  bounds = shape.bounds 
1330                  form.vars.lon_min = bounds[0] 
1331                  form.vars.lat_min = bounds[1] 
1332                  form.vars.lon_max = bounds[2] 
1333                  form.vars.lat_max = bounds[3] 
1334              except: 
1335                  form.errors.gis_feature_type = self.messages.centroid_error 
1336          else: 
1337              form.errors.gis_feature_type = self.messages.unknown_type 
1338   
1339          return
